main event: A witness reported observing a bright, round or oval-shaped light in the sky that emitted a constant white light and rapidly gained altitude while moving in a westerly direction over Kawanna, Indiana on November 1, 1968.
interesting points: The object was described as hovering at about 1,000 feet and was visible for less than a minute., The observer estimated the speed of the object to be between 500-1,000 mph., No sound was heard from the object during the sighting., A bright star or planet was noted to be in the vicinity during the sighting., The investigation concluded no unknown aircraft were present in the area at the time of the sighting.
witness description: Richard E. Rauscher, a civilian with part-time work in surveying
